header_summary:
Ava Chow announced the availability of Bitcoin Core version v28.0rc1, a significant update aimed at enhancing the software's functionality and security. This release candidate allows users to trial the new version and contribute feedback for final adjustments before its official release, with detailed insights and preliminary notes accessible for review ([Bitcoin Core Release Candidate Information](https://bitcoincore.org/bin/bitcoin-core-28.0/test.rc1/)).

Antoine Riard proposed the establishment of "free-to-pwn" lightning nodes on the mainnet to facilitate real-world testing of sophisticated cross-layer attacks, such as pinning. This initiative seeks to improve the Bitcoin ecosystem by demonstrating vulnerabilities under actual operating conditions, encouraging a broader discussion on security and the robustness of the network ([Linux Foundation Mailing List Archive](https://lists.linuxfoundation.org/pipermail/bitcoin-dev/2021-May/018925.html)).

Discussion led by Antoine Riard and victorkstarkware explored advancements and challenges in Bitcoin's computational capabilities and transaction security. They delved into the potential of re-enabling OP_CAT for general computation on Bitcoin and addressed concerns over transaction vulnerabilities like replacement cycling attacks. These conversations highlight ongoing efforts to enhance Bitcoin's security and versatility, with significant contributions from the community towards developing solutions ([Bitcoin Wildlife Sanctuary](https://github.com/Bitcoin-Wildlife-Sanctuary)).

Fi3 introduced an SV2 extension proposal aimed at improving transparency and fairness in mining pool payouts, enabling miners to have greater control over selecting transactions. This development represents a step forward in refining the operational framework of mining pools, with the project actively seeking community feedback to perfect the system ([PPLNS with Job Declaration](https://github.com/demand-open-source/pplns-with-job-declaration/blob/bd7258db08e843a5d3732bec225644eda6923e48/pplns-with-job-declaration.pdf)).

recent_posts.title: Bitcoin Core 28.0 Release Candidate 1 Available
recent_posts.summary:
- Bitcoin Core's latest version v28.0rc1 is now available for download.
- Preliminary release notes for v28.0rc1 offer insights into the major changes and improvements.
- Feedback from this release candidate will help identify critical issues before the final v28.0 release.

recent_posts.title: Demonstrating Pinning Attacks under Real-World Conditions
recent_posts.summary:
- Antoine proposes "free-to-pwn" lightning nodes on mainnet for realistic attack testing.
- The setup aims for real-world conditions to critically evaluate Bitcoin's security.
- Public tests are intended to reveal protocol vulnerabilities and discuss economic effects on LSPs.

recent_posts.title: Keyless Anchors Are Vulnerable To Replacement Cycling Attacks
recent_posts.summary:
- Bitcoin transaction vulnerabilities, like replacement cycling attacks, are discussed.
- LSPs and exchanges could manipulate transactions, exploiting system weaknesses for malicious batching.
- Issues with rebroadcasting and node vulnerability to DDoS attacks highlight security challenges.

recent_posts.title: The path to general computation on Bitcoin (with OP_CAT)
recent_posts.summary:
- Taproot upgrade and OP_CAT re-enabling enhance Bitcoin's computational capabilities.
- Recent tools like covenants and STARK proofs aim at overcoming Bitcoin script limitations.
- Innovations promise to expand Bitcoin's utility for sophisticated programming and smart contracts.

recent_posts.title: PPLNS with job declaration
recent_posts.summary:
- An SV2 extension is being developed to improve transparency and fairness in mining payouts.
- The extension enables miners to select transactions, offering control over job fee structures.
- The project, still in development, seeks contributions to refine the system.

active_posts.title: Mining pools, stratumv2 and oblivious shares
active_posts.summary:
- The discussion highlights Stratum V2's risks, including block withholding attacks and validation issues.
- A proposed solution suggests a negotiated template approach for safer and more democratic mining.
- Concerns include a need for protocol changes to improve security, efficiency, and decentralization in mining.

active_posts.title: OP_ZKP updates
active_posts.summary:
- The OP_ZKP proposal integrates Zero-Knowledge Proofs in Bitcoin, seeking an appropriate scheme.
- Security and efficiency guide the choice, emphasizing batched verification and minimal block space usage.
- Future considerations include device performance impacts, with potential alternatives like Dory if issues persist.

active_posts.title: OP_CAT Research Fund sponsored by StarkWare
active_posts.summary:
- StarkWare launches a $1 million bounty for insights on OP_CAT's activation.
- The committee includes Andrew Poelstra and aims to foster community debate on OP_CAT.
- Participants can submit their arguments via StarkWare's provided link for consideration.

active_posts.title: Great Consensus Cleanup Revival
active_posts.summary:
- The analysis suggests improvements for Bitcoin's security and performance, addressing key vulnerabilities.
- Proposed changes include adjusting mining difficulty and limiting transaction sizes to enhance stability.
- Community debate centers on block size reduction's impact on scalability and efficiency.

active_posts.title: Who will run the CoinJoin coordinators?
active_posts.summary:
- Recent crackdowns led to the closure of Samourai and Wasabi Wallet's privacy services.
- Alternatives like JoinMarket and the BTCPay Server CoinJoin plugin have gained popularity.
- The future of Bitcoin privacy services is uncertain, with potential for decentralized solutions.

active_posts.title: Casual research on running `mempoolfullrbf`
active_posts.summary:

today_in_history_posts.title: Selfish Mining Prevention
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- Selfish mining involves colluders mining at a reduced hashrate for profit.
- To counter this, block rewards could be modulated based on peak hashrate metrics.
- Implementing this may require a dynamic difficulty adjustment and a plan for fee market transition.

today_in_history_posts.title: Measuring centrality of nodes in LN graph
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- Kulpreet analyzes Lightning Network nodes' centrality to enhance payment routing and network stability.
- He uses methods from Freeman and Tarjan's papers to measure node centrality and dominance.
- Kulpreet invites feedback on his findings shared in a Medium post, aiming for further LN analysis.

today_in_history_posts.title: Public archive for Delving Bitcoin
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- A public archive creation for a site is proposed to prevent content loss and enhance searchability.
- Utilizing an API or database dumping are preferred methods over scraping due to complexity and accessibility issues.
- The recommendation is to share archive results on a git repository for public access and redundancy.
